str2: A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
Probably from an obsolete phrao; the midrif, i.e. the feelings (also in the plural) the mind or cognitive faculties).
Neuter diminutive of pais; a childling, i.e., an infant, or a half-grown boy or girl; figuratively, an immature Christian.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From kakos; badness, i.e. depravity, or malignity, or trouble.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To be childlike, childish, infantile. From nepios; to act as a babe, i.e. innocently.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from an obsolete phrao; the midrif, i.e. the feelings (also in the plural) the mind or cognitive faculties).

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
